intro: Tridactylites annuus, commonly known as the annual tridactyl, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its composite flower heads composed of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with linear, hairy leaves and yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. Tridactylites annuus is an important plant for pollinators and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
